Articles.Content:
"Shipyard Battles" is a new Sub series i will be doing on my YouTube channel. It features a fully cinematic 1v1 or fleet engagement battle arena in every episode. Selection is completely randomized so submissions will never know what they will face. Every episode is a random 1v1 or fleet engagement (Carrier battles coming soon). Before you ask, More than one person is piloting the ships. so there is no guaranteed winner. Submissions will be taken Via thread reply and should include the following...

Mods:

The only mod allowed is BDarmory for most ship classes, and with minor limitations.

Ship Types:

Command Cruisers: Medium Armed, Large vessels with lots of comms to link with the rest of the fleet, Max parts 500 (STOCK ONLY)

Frigates: Battleships with real Armor and weapons, Can range from light to medium armament. 500 part limit (BDarmory Weapons allowed)

Destroyers: Battleships With Heavy armor and Medium to Heavy weapons. 500 part limit. (BDarmory weapons allowed)

Battle cruisers & Dreadnoughts: Extremely large, Heavy Cavalry Vessels with High tier weapons and armor. 700 part limit. (BDarmory weapons allowed)

Links:

Give a link to your craft file(s), preferably via media-fire. Include a photo or video of the craft showing what it looks like and what it can do, utility deployment gear such as radio cloaks and War satellites are allowed on all vessels. Do NOT include assent stages when submitting the craft file as it takes up the part limit.

Fleets:

If you are submitting a fleet, you can submit from 2 to 4 ships. use ONE command cruiser (Required), And use the other spaces for frigates and destroyers, there is also a 1 optional dreadnought slot, but it does count to your 4 maximum vessels.

Corporations (Optional)

Lastly, you can include your corporation name and it will be displayed on your forces. you can name your ships and put them with your submission and they will also be displayed.

I am also including a submission template to help a few people who I may have confused.
